reviewText: After so many years of not seeing this show, it brought back so many wonderful memories of what family life was like back in the 1950's, when life was a lot simpler.  What I failed to realize years ago is that this show was really "real" and not just fluff  - there was always a life lesson learned.I am anxiously looking forward to the 6th season - let's go Shout Factory - you always do an awesome job!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Dear Shout Factory,Please keep the "Father Knows Best" seasons coming....I am a guaranteed customer for season 5 & 6. We are too close to the complete set to quit now. Thanks!Update:This next to last season 5 release from Shout is a great deal in Canada. It costs $39.99 US in the USA as it is a Shout store direct only purchase. Amazon.ca has it much cheaper for us Canadians so I quickly added it to my Father Knows Best collection. You won't be disappointed, the quality is A-1...now just one more season to go to complete all 6 seasons.

reviewText: Attention all Amazon shoppers looking for Father Knows Best Season 5 (and probably 6 eventually).  Sales on Season 4 were so low that it appears Shout Factory will not be making Season 5 available to retailers.They will be producing the DVD on a order-by-order basis for passionate fans.  Go here [...] to order it from their store.They will begin producing them on August 17th 2010, but again as stated they will not be shipping to retailers (unless the retailers order the DVDs themselves at full retail - yeeeeaaaahhhh not going to happen), but to consumers that order them directly.
summary: Sales fall short, but DVD available.  Just not here.

reviewText: How marvelous to see Season Five - there had been some talk that it would not be re-issued as sales for Season Four were not what had been expected. Guess all the nay-sayers were wrong!If you love the series, you will love Season Five.  I won't go into details on the contents, as they have been described elsewhere on this site, suffice to say that it is the continuation (and next to last season) of the beloved series.  The writing and production values remain high, each episode exuding great humanity, warmth and humor.  Not much  more to say. An excellent and timeless show, well worth the purchase price.

reviewText: FKB is one of my favorite TV shows. Although I would have liked giving it Five Stars, I felt honesty best, so clicked four Stars.First, the price was awfully high. According to other Amazon feed-backers, Season 5 could only be bought through Shout Factory.Reading this is baffling. I got my copy here on Amazon, for 39.00 plus shipping. Am I missing something? Is there a problem with the copy I purchased from this Amazon seller? I believe there is/was only one. If so, please leave a comment.Second. As I stated above, I love Father Knows Best Show, but I felt cheated with certain episodes on Season 5. They were repeats from earlier shows. The idea was to 'think back' to a time when....I wonder how long final rehearsal and taping took to complete a 'Memory Lane' episode. It couldn't have taken long, considering while going back to a time when,,,,,the original show was aired. In other words, they weren't made-up to look younger, redid the show. The kids were grown, so that'd be a little tricky.There might be a reason. Perhaps one of the actors got sick, had problems, or just grew tired.Last, it would have been great if the DVD's included Special Features. Deleted scenes, Bloopers, Interviews. There are numerous rumors why Billy Gray didn't do an interview.I hope Shout Factory decides to release Season 6. Waiting is torture, lol. Even waiting to hear if they'll release it or not is painful. So, please do.

reviewText: This and other seasons of Father Knows Best are pure enjoyment for almost everyone.  It is classic tv at its best although there are repeat episodes in this season and season 6.  Picture and sound quality are great and packaging is at least in plastic for this season vs. the paper sheaths in 1-4.  Season 5 is more durable for keepsake value than the previously mentioned 1-4 in paper jacket boxes

reviewText: I know, I know, I hear all the tantrums being over this release only being offered through Shout! Select.  It is a shame that the only way you can order this is through them.  But hey people...at least it's on DVD.  That aside, many fans and critics consider this season to be the best of the series.  There are more stand-out episodes than any other season.  First and foremost is the FORMULA FOR HAPPINESS, a weird show that has Jim {"Father"] having a creepy dream that later begins to come true.  This show filmed in 1958 was a forerunner to Rod Serlings' classic series, TWILIGHT ZONE, which bowed on CBS the next year.  I wonder what he thought of that segment?  Other standouts include THE GOOD SAMARITAN, which has son "Bud" and friend help out a needy man who is down on his luck.  Their intentions are good, but not appreciated.  And the unexpected twist in the middle of the show is somewhat jarring.  Mother "Margaret Wins a Car," a $5,000 beauty.  Emmy winner Jane Wyatt plays that episode with heart and compassion, when he helps out the orphanage by giving the kids a ride for a picnic, much to her own kids displeasure.  Selfish? Yup, but it all works out in the end.  The shows which focus on Billy Gray as Bud seem to be the best ones.  Another good one is BUD AND THE DEBUTTANTE, which features Gray squiring around a rich girl. I have always wondered if Gray was ever nominated for a best supporting actor Emmy, cause he definitely deserved it.  All in all, a great season for fans and non-fans alike.  Bonus features {alas, no new Bill Gray interviews] include two episodes of Robert Young's next series, WINDOW ON MAIN STREET.  Father Knows Best and Marcus Welby sandwiched this show, which is so-so.  Still it's nice to see Young play another character.  FKB season 5 is a gotta have.  The only reason I gave it four out of five stars is that it is not closed-captioned.
